data.title: Sysout-Calls in AWTPanel
data.body:
Could you guys please remove the Sysout-Calls in the AwtPanel class or maybe replace it with a logger. Especially when resizing the awt-panel in a swing environment, the console should be quiet.

Affected lines: 102, 115, 125, 144, 152, 154

data.title: Typo in assert
data.body:
Hi.

In file [jme3-jbullet/src/main/java/com/jme3/bullet/PhysicsSpace.java, line 230](https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/46891b32c69e8696947a12b4069d8c7383f87d3f/jme3-jbullet/src/main/java/com/jme3/bullet/PhysicsSpace.java#L230)

bp.clientObject is checked twice:

```
assert (
bp.clientObject instanceof com.bulletphysics.collision.dispatch.CollisionObject && 
bp.clientObject instanceof com.bulletphysics.collision.dispatch.CollisionObject
);
```

Probably, it should be:

```
assert (
bp.clientObject instanceof com.bulletphysics.collision.dispatch.CollisionObject && 
bp1.clientObject instanceof com.bulletphysics.collision.dispatch.CollisionObject
);
```

This possible defect found by [statis analyzer AppChecker](https://cnpo.ru/en/solutions/appchecker.php)

data.title: Mouse cursor disappearing after changing it multiple times
data.body:
Mouse cursor disappearing after changing it multiple times. When you do it often enough and there is no way to get it back. We are using the same JmeCursor object instance. And setting it simply with com.jme3.input.InputManager inputManager.setMouseCursor().

We are changing it often depending on what the user interaction is. Seems that LibGDX has also stumbled upon this feature: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2841.

I also tested with LWJGL 3. And the same problem exists. The problem is present in both JME 3.0 and 3.1.

Forum discussion:
https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/mouse-cursor-disappearing-after-changing-it-multiple-times/36458

data.title: JMonkeyEngine Simple Application changes screen resolution on exit
data.body:
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04.1 LTS (64 bits).
- Graphics card: NVIDIA Corporation GK104M [GeForce GTX 870M] (rev a1).
- Driver version: 361.42 (proprietary).
- Using OpenJDK version "1.8.0_91".
- Running vanilla jMonkeyEngineSDK 3.0.
- Laptop running with dual cards (but only the powerful nVidia one should be running).

Steps to reproduce:
1) Create new basic application project.
2) Run it.
3) Close it pressing 'esc'.

What happens: regardless of the application resolution / fullscreen or windowed mode, the desktop resolution is changed to something like 640 \* 480 (I can't say for sure because the 'monitors' dialog still shows 1920 \* 1080). Everything comes back to normal by changing the resolution back manually.

data.title: Added RenderState.BlendMode.Custom
data.body: BlendMode.Custom allows glBlendFuncSeparate() calls.

data.title: OpenCL/LWJGL3 implementation uses deprecated objects like CLDevice
data.body:
The current jME3 OpenCL implementation likely works, but if you try & use the latest LWJGL 3 release, it won't compile. CLDevice wrappers were removed in the latest release:

https://github.com/LWJGL/lwjgl3/releases

... due to this issue:

https://github.com/LWJGL/lwjgl3/issues/152

See current usage of CLDevice here:

https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/blob/master/jme3-lwjgl3/src/main/java/com/jme3/opencl/lwjgl/LwjglDevice.java

They likely want a simple "long" define of the device, instead of CLDevice, which is the address.

data.title: BufferAllocator Round 2
data.body:
Allows a flexible interface to use own Allocators.

This has two uses: 
1. the current one does not work at all under Java9 (and it brings a simpler one that does)
2. it allows to use better/faster native ones, like the ones included in lwjgl and jogl2.

The default behavior is trying to load the old reflection based one, and Fallback to the simpler if an exception occurs. This allows to use JME in java9, while not changing established behavior.

data.title: Update to Bullet 2.83.7
OpenCL for jME3 - some missing features
data.body:
Hi,
after working some time with the wrapper, I found three important missing features that improved the workflow once implemented.
- missing `toString()` methods, useful for debugging
- added getter method for the device in the command queue, necessary e.g. to query the work group size
-  the `register()` methods for the automatic garbage collection of OpenCL objects now returns `this`. This is important so that e.g. `Buffer b = clContext.createBuffer(1).register();` can be written in one line

data.title: Suggestion: TTF font loading
data.body:
Hey! I just got started with your engine and I have to say It is really good! :).
However a small thing I noticed is the fact that there is no way of loading .ttf fonts, which is kind of weird because I _especially_ use .ttf fonts. Is there a way to Implement it.

data.title: Wrong light position from .blend
data.body:
I have created a .blend and added a Cube and a Light (I tried Point  and Directional Light), I setup light position to (0, 5, 2) and saved the .blend file.

On JME3:
Right click .blend file "Convert to j3o Binary", Double click .j3o(or .blend file), it generate a empty node with position (0, 5, 2) and a light on position (0, 0, 0). On render the light bright from position (0, 0, 0).

Scene
    |-- Point [Node(0, 5, 2)]
        |-- LightControl [Property Light is Empty]
    |-- Cube
    |-- PointLight [PointLight(0, 0, 0)]

Is it a bug or I am making something wrong?

**Environment:**
**Product Version:** jMonkeyEngine SDK 3.1.0-beta1-SNAPSHOT
**Java:** 1.8.0_77; Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit
**System:** Elementary OS 0.3.2 Freya [Ubuntu based](Linux version 3.19.0-64-generic running on amd64)

data.title: GL_CLAMP_TO_BORDER is not supported
data.body: The four texture addressing modes of OpenGL 3.3+ are _GL_REPEAT_, _GL_MIRRORED_REPEAT_, _GL_CLAMP_TO_EDGE_ and _**GL_CLAMP_TO_BORDER**_. The latter is not supported by JME3.1, but is needed to fully load a COLLADA model for example. All wrap modes should be available.

data.title: Garbage collection and list iteration improvements for v3.1
data.body: Same as https://github.com/jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine/pull/515, but for v3.1.

data.title: Iterator garbage collection improvement
Garbage collection and list iteration improvements
data.body:
For-Each loop creates Iterator object and uses hasNext and next methods, which are slower, than manual iteration. Also allocating Iterator object increases work for GC.

Forum post: https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/iteration-over-list-performance-improvement/36250

See test 9 for more details: http://www.devahead.com/blog/2011/12/coding-for-performance-and-avoiding-garbage-collection-in-android/

data.title: Fix npe
Removed warning if scale=1,1,1 in CylinderCollisionShape
data.body:
<strike>That method just prints a warning, so from my point of view there is no reason to leave the call there.
EDIT: I want to point out that this is an issue because when cylinder shapes are created frequently the logs are polluted with warnings about scaling when the developer isn't actually trying to scale the shape.</strike>
See below.
